page.title: 01Hannington Introduction
page.content: Hannington is a small peaceful village situated on the Hampshire Downs 200 m above sea level with outstanding views ofopen countryside and land given to a large proportion of arable cultivation The towns of Basingstoke & Newbury are almost equidistant. The population is 280 including the small hamlet of North Oakley, with an equal percent of young & old. Although we have some historical buildings-few amenities: no main drainage system, only septic tanks. No street lighting, no shops, Post Office or Library other than mo- bile services. No mains gas only elec- tricity, woodburning stoves & oil. No public transport apart from a twice weekly bus service. No school,this was closed in July 1984. This is an active community supporting many club activities for all ages.
